hedline.hl1: Metro Business; Corning to Build In Rochester Suburb

abstract.p: Corning Inc will build $80 million plant in Rochester suburb to produce components for fiber optic communication networks (S)

block.p: Corning Inc. said yesterday that it would build an $80 million plant in the Rochester suburb of Henrietta, N.Y., that would produce components for fiber optic communication networks.

The plant, to be built in an existing factory, is expected to create 440 jobs, the company said. The announcement comes several weeks after Corning said it would spend $50 million to expand a similar three-year-old plant it operates in Erwin, N.Y., a step that a Corning spokesman, Dan Collins, said would add 700 jobs to the 1,500 there. The company is also building a third similar plant in Scranton, Pa.
Corning Inc. said yesterday that it would build an $80 million plant in the Rochester suburb of Henrietta, N.Y., that would produce components for fiber optic communication networks.

The plant, to be built in an existing factory, is expected to create 440 jobs, the company said. The announcement comes several weeks after Corning said it would spend $50 million to expand a similar three-year-old plant it operates in Erwin, N.Y., a step that a Corning spokesman, Dan Collins, said would add 700 jobs to the 1,500 there. The company is also building a third similar plant in Scranton, Pa.

The state's Empire State Development Corporation is to provide Corning with a $4.3 million grant toward the $80 million cost, and the company is eligible for $10 million more in the form of state tax breaks. Charles A. Gargano, the agency's chairman, said that the aid package persuaded Corning to build in the state rather than at a site in Georgia, which the company was considering.
Mr. Collins said that production would begin early next year at the Henrietta site, which will make items that amplify the electronic signal used in fiber optic communication systems.
